alert.note: Alert for Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 08 at 2:09AM PST until January 08 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Periods of heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches, except more than 3 feet possible above 5500 feet. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Western Siskiyou County and Central Siskiyou County above 4000 feet. This includes Highway 3 south of Callahan, Sawyers Bar Road west of Etna, and Grayback Road in Northwest Siskiyou County. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible with snow covered roads and limited visibility. Strong winds and the heavy wet snow could cause tree damage. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent or occurring and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County
